com.ibm.team.repository.client
Interface IStatistics

All Superinterfaces:
IEventSource
public interface IStatistics
extends IEventSource

Statistics data for a particular team repository.

The statistics object is a generic event source for events of type IPropertyChangeEvent. Its parent event source is ITeamRepository.

This interface is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only as its usage could impact the performance and memory usage of the client APIs.

Statistics will only be collected if listeners are registered against the IStatistics event source.

Since:
0.5

ITeamRepository teamRepository()
Returns the repository associated with this object. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

Returns:
the repository, which is never null

getServiceMethodCallCount

long getServiceMethodCallCount(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
Returns a cumulative number of times the given service method was called. The method is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

The counter behaves as a monotonically non-decreasing function over time. Calls to API operations marked "ShortOp" are not supposed to contact the server; so call count should remain constant across callCount to those (it would be a bug if it did not). Calls to API operations marked "LongOp" are allowed to contact the server. Typically an operation makes exactly one call to the server.

Parameters:
method - the service method; must not be null.
Returns:
the service method call count

getServiceMethodElapsedTime

long getServiceMethodElapsedTime(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
Returns a cumulative time the given service method had spent running. The method is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

The counter behaves as a monotonically non-decreasing function over time. Calls to API operations marked "ShortOp" are not supposed to contact the server; so elapsed time should remain constant across callCount to those (it would be a bug if it did not). Calls to API operations marked "LongOp" are allowed to contact the server. Typically an operation makes exactly one call to the server.

Parameters:
method - the service method; must not be null.
Returns:
the service method elapsed time

services for which we have gathered statistics; never null.

getServiceCallCount

long getServiceCallCount(java.lang.String service)
Returns a cumulative number of times the given service was called. The method is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

The counter behaves as a monotonically non-decreasing function over time. Calls to API operations marked "ShortOp" are not supposed to contact the server; so call count should remain constant across callCount to those (it would be a bug if it did not). Calls to API operations marked "LongOp" are allowed to contact the server. Typically an operation makes exactly one call to the server.

Parameters:
service - the service; must not be null.
Returns:
the service call count

getServiceElapsedTime

long getServiceElapsedTime(java.lang.String service)
Returns a cumulative time the given service had spent running. The method is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

The counter behaves as a monotonically non-decreasing function over time. Calls to API operations marked "ShortOp" are not supposed to contact the server; so elapsed time should remain constant across callCount to those (it would be a bug if it did not). Calls to API operations marked "LongOp" are allowed to contact the server. Typically an operation makes exactly one call to the server.

Parameters:
service - the service; must not be null.
Returns:
the service call count

getTotalServiceCallCount

long getTotalServiceCallCount()
Returns a cumulative number of times the underlying services were contacted. The method is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

The counter behaves as a monotonically non-decreasing function over time. Calls to API operations marked "ShortOp" are not supposed to contact the server; so call should remain constant across callCount to those (it would be a bug if it did not). Calls to API operations marked "LongOp" are allowed to contact the server. Typically an operation makes exactly one call to the server.

Returns:
the total number of service callCount

getTotalServiceElapsedTime

long getTotalServiceElapsedTime()
Returns a cumulative time the underlying services had been running. The method is intended to be used for test/debug purposes only. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

The counter behaves as a monotonically non-decreasing function over time. Calls to API operations marked "ShortOp" are not supposed to contact the server; so call should remain constant across callCount to those (it would be a bug if it did not). Calls to API operations marked "LongOp" are allowed to contact the server. Typically an operation makes exactly one call to the server.

Returns:
the total number of service callCount

enabled

boolean enabled()
Returns true if statistics are being collected.

Statistics will only be collected if listeners are registered against the IStatistics event source.

Returns:
true if statistics are being collected.

enable

void enable()
Explicitly enable the receiver. After this method is called IStatistics.incStatisticValue(String, Object, String, long) and IStatistics.decStatisticValue(String, Object, String, long) will update the receiver.
